Justification: To check for signs of infection or inflammation, such as elevated white blood cell count.
To visualize the abdominal organs and identify any abnormalities such as gallstones, appendicitis, or other potential causes of pain.
To rule out urinary tract infection or kidney stones, which can also cause abdominal pain.
To assess liver health and rule out liver-related issues that could cause abdominal pain.
To check for any electrolyte imbalances that may be contributing to symptoms, especially with constipation.

Investigation: CT Scan of the Abdomen (if indicated)
Justification: To provide a more detailed view of the abdominal organs if the ultrasound findings are inconclusive or if there is a suspicion of a serious condition.
